AppEngine Temp Table Debug Class

Sep 12, 2015 • {"login"=>"evlpanda", "email"=>"m.nitschke@gmail.com", "display_name"=>"Michael Nitschke", "first_name"=>"", "last_name"=>""}

This class acts like it says on the box and is a debugging utility. Specifically for Application Engines. A work in progress.


import YOUR_LIBRARY:Utilities:AEDebug:*;

&debug = create ADO_EI_LIBRARY:Utilities:AEDebug();
&debug.logFile = &logFile;
&debug.logFileData = &logFileData;

&debug.LogTempTable("AE_TEMP_TABLE_TAO");

I've recently added in the JQuery bit, and 'sticky' table headings, but haven't really been on a platform that will handle it (old version of IE).

Er, reading the code now I am not sure how it actually works. It really does always get the correct AE Temp Table instance. Black Magic.

Disclaimer: made minor alterations in text edit before saving online. May be typos.

The code doesn't format very well in this blog so here's a link. AEDebug Class
